node.title: Crypto has been deemed not halal in Indonesia. This is what it means for nearly 7 million investors
node.alt: Two women doing a transactions in the syariah bank in Indonesia.
node.description: The religious council in Indonesia says cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin are forbidden. What does it mean for the millions of crypto enthusiasts across the country?
node.content:
["Trading of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin\u00a0has been declared forbidden for Muslims by the national council\u00a0of Islamic scholars in Indonesia, as the popularity of digital currencies grows in the world's largest Muslim-majority country.", "During a recent\u00a0online forum, Indonesia's quasi-governmental\u00a0Ulama Council\u00a0declared a fatwa, or\u00a0a non-binding religious ruling, that cryptocurrency is haram \u2014 forbidden under Islamic law.", "An Ulama is a Muslim scholar who is recognised as having specialised knowledge in Islam.", "According to Islamic law, a transaction should follow certain requirements, such as having a physical form and definite value.", "\"Cryptocurrency as currency is forbidden because it has elements of uncertainty, harm\u00a0and doesn't meet the Islamic requirement according to Shariah [law],\" KH Asrorun Niam Sholeh, the council's head of religious decrees, said in the forum.", "However, Mr Sholeh added that although cryptocurrencies as a currency is forbidden, it could be traded as a commodity or digital assets if they meet requirements.", "The council\u00a0has served as an authority on Shariah compliance in Indonesia, but they\u00a0have\u00a0been criticised\u00a0for other controversial fatwa.", "In 2018, it issued a fatwa raising concerns about a\u00a0measles-rubella vaccine due to it containing traces of pork and human cells.", "The council also issues halal\u00a0certificates \u2014 the opposite of haram \u2014 for food and other consumed products in the country.", "Nahdlatul Ulama (NU) is one of the\u00a0world's biggest Islamic organisations with around 90 million members and followers.", "In October, its\u00a0East Java branch also issued a fatwa declaring cryptocurrencies haram.", "Deputy Chairman of the East Java NU, Ahmad Fahrur Rozi, known as Gus Fahrur, told the ABC the fatwa was based on the results from a forum discussion of issues on Islamic jurisprudence.", "", "
Nahdlatul Ulama is Indonesia's largest Muslim organisation, with at least 90 million members.(Reuters: Supri)
", "One of the conclusions that came from the discussion, attended by both crypto and Islamic legal experts, was that crypto trading tends to involve \"fraudulent practices and gambling\".", "\"Just like\u00a0it's not allowed for a person to buy indistinct objects, like 'fishes in the sea'\u00a0or 'birds in the air',\" Gus Fahrur told the ABC.", "He said cryptocurrencies was also similar to gambling because people speculate about the value without knowing the cause.", "Practices such as gambling are not allowed in Islam, since the value and price\u00a0are indefinite and could financially and physiologically\u00a0harm\u00a0those involved.", "In comparison, he said\u00a0stocks had a clear value and the price increased or decreased depending on the company\u2019s performance.", "Because of the huge elements of speculation over the value of cryptocurrencies, they considered it\u00a0\"inappropriate to be used as an investment instrument\", he said.", "
The booming trend of crypto in Indonesia
", "", "
Putri Madarina hopes there will be more robust discussions about cryptocurrencies from an Islamic perspective that may change the fatwa.(Supplied)
", "According to Indonesia's Ministry of Trade data, the number of crypto investors in the country had grown from 4 million people\u00a0at the end of 2020, to 6.5 million people by the end of May 2021.\u00a0", "It has exceeded the number of investors in the share\u00a0market, which is around 2.4 million according to Bank Indonesia \u2014 the central bank.", "Putri Madarina, a certified financial planner and founder of Halal Vestor, a Shariah financial planner and education service\u00a0in Jakarta, said the flourishing interest in crypto investing in Indonesia was partly due to social media, especially TikTok.", "\"It is even booming during the COVID-19 pandemic, we are actually in the second wave of the crypto trend,\" Ms Madarina told the ABC, referring to the crypto\u00a0boom three years ago.", "Ms Madarina has been investing in crypto since 2017 and said the Islamic decree hadn't deterred\u00a0her from continuing to\u00a0invest\u00a0in crypto.", "\"What we bought is a digital commodity, like a collection that we consider valuable,\" she said.", "She also considered crypto as a 'mal' \u2014 an Islamic term for property \u2014 which can take in many forms.", "\"So, as a medium of exchange, I think it's not a problem,\" said Ms Madarina, who is also a treasurer of an Islamic fintech association in Indonesia.", "\"As a property, I don't see any Islamic ruling being violated, unless it was made to be a means of deception, which is also an external factor that we can't control.\"", "
'I am a Muslim, I follow the fatwa'
", "", "
Ainun Najib followed the fatwa and released all his bitcoin assets.(Supplied)
", "Ainun Najib is an Indonesian NU member based in Singapore who works in IT.", "He only started investing in cryptocurrencies in January 2021.", "He said he knew\u00a0about the halal and haram controversy, but there was no official fatwa from any religious organisations at that time.", "He considered buying Bitcoin just like buying land or gold, but in a digital form which was protected by \"mathematically impenetrable encryption\".", "\"I initially intended\u00a0[to keep bitcoin]\u00a0as an asset, as my long-term savings. By long term, I'm talking about 10 to 20 years.\"", "But in less than a year\u00a0Mr Najib decided to release all his bitcoin assets worth $45,000 in total.\u00a0", "\"Because of the fatwa [from NU East Java],\" he said, explaining the reasons behind his decision.", "", "
The number\u00a0of crypto investors has surpassed the number\u00a0of investors in Indonesia's stock exchange.(Kompas: Garry Andrew Lutolung)
", "He said although he\u00a0understood the blockchain technology used in cryptocurrencies, for him the fatwa was an \"expert recommendation\", like how doctors recommend a patient with a high risk of cancer to quit smoking and drinking alcohol.", "He feels that given he has\u00a0no knowledge on religious law,\u00a0he\u00a0needs to hand those decisions over to\u00a0experts in the field, like the Kyai \u2014 an expert in Islam \u2014 or religious scholars.", "\"I am a Muslim. In the context of Islam, I follow the fatwa,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"[But] it's our choice whether to follow it or not. But I think\u00a0the right decision would be to follow it.\"", "
Fatwas may change in the future
", "Cryptocurrency is still being discussed widely among Islamic scholars and institutions around the globe.", "In 2018, the Grand Mufti of Egypt banned Bitcoin trading as it was prone to risks for the traders due to the price fluctuations.\u00a0", "Haitham al-Haddad, a British Muslim scholar, also considered cryptocurrencies not halal since it is a virtual currency with \"no tangible worth\".", "Similar views have also shared by individual Muslim scholars in countries\u00a0such as Turkey, Malaysia, and Saudi Arabia.", "But others have\u00a0taken the opposite view, including South Africa's\u00a0Darul Uloom Zakariyya,\u00a0Pakistan-based Shariah Adisory Muhammad Abu Bakar, and other Muslim scholars in Qatar and\u00a0United Arab Emirates.", "Ms Madarina said cryptocurrency was such a \"hot topic\" in the Muslim world.", "She added the new Islamic decree would less likely impact\u00a0the decisions of cryptocurrency\u00a0investors, and instead be an\u00a0\"an eye-opener\" for investors or those who are about to enter the market.", "\"And I haven't seen yet a drop in numbers of interest.\"", "", "
KH Ahmad Fahrur Rozi says\u00a0if there are developments regarding cryptocurrencies the fatwa could change.(Supplied)
", "Gus Fahrur said fatwa were not rigid and the views of Islamic scholars on crypto trading may change.", "\"The fatwa is dynamic. If [cryptocurrencies] no longer contain an element of speculation and \u2026 if there is an official regulation\u00a0from the state which protects it from speculators, then we will have no issues.\"", "He emphasised the fatwa at the moment was aimed at protecting the community.", "\"Everyone wants to make a profit, right? But please don't speculate,\" he said.", "\"What if cryptocurrencies collapse because they were not built on a valid and strong foundation, what will happen?", "And for Mr Najib there is a possibility for him to get back into investing in cryptocurrencies\u00a0in the future.", "\"When the expert changes [their] view, it's fine, we can also follow it again \u2026 if there is an updated fatwa, then I will follow it again.\""]
